dropbox_text1: Click to select file or drag here
dropbox_text2: Click to select a different file or drag here
infopage_title2: How to archive and extract files?
info_2: DailyCrypt is a simple website for encryption. Our goal is to make encryption accessible for everyone.
info_3: DailyCrypt is made without backend to ensure safety. Our code is open-source, making it available for everyone.
zip_info_1: You need to archive your files before encryption. Choose your operating system to see how to archive or extract your files.
ubuntu_instruction_1: Select the files you want to encrypt
ubuntu_instruction_4: The file will appear in the same folder
ubuntu_instruction_5: Select a file you want to extract (needs to be a zip file)
ubuntu_instruction_7: Extracted file will appear in the same folder
windows_instruction_1: Select the files you want to encrypt
windows_instruction_2: Right-click and click 'Send to' then click 'Compressed (zipped) folder'
windows_instruction_3: The zipped file will appear in the same folder
windows_instruction_4: Select the compressed file you want to extract
windows_instruction_6: Select a destination for the file
windows_instruction_7: Extracted file will appear in the chosen destination
mac_instruction_1: Select the files you want to encrypt
mac_instruction_3: The zipped file will appear in the same folder
mac_instruction_4: Double-click the file you want to extract
mac_instruction_5: Extracted file will appear in the same folder
empty_file_encrypt: You need to select a file before you can encrypt it.
empty_file_decrypt: You need to select a file before you can decrypt it.
empty_password_encrypt: You need to enter an encryption password to encrypt a file.
empty_password_decrypt: You need to enter a decryption password (the same password you used to encrypt the file) to decrypt a file.
mismatch_text: The passwords you entered don't match.
wrong_password_text: The decrypting password you entered is not the same one that was used for encrypting.
loading_file: Waiting for file to be loaded...
